meanings.definition: Not having corresponding valves or shells of equal size or shape.
meanings.sent1: The inequivalve clam had one shell much larger than the other.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the inequivalve shells to understand their differences.
meanings.sent3: The inequivalve oysters decided to have a race to see who could swim faster.
meanings.sent4: The inequivalve nature of the situation made it difficult to find a fair solution.
meanings.sent5: The inequivalve shapes of the shells were like mismatched puzzle pieces.

meanings.sent1: The inequivalve mussels displayed varying sizes in their shells.
meanings.sent2: The diver collected inequivalve shells from the ocean floor.
meanings.sent3: The inequivalve clams argued about which shell was more stylish.
meanings.sent4: The inequivalve appearance of the shells reminded her of a broken mirror.
meanings.sent5: The inequivalve shapes of the shells created a beautiful pattern on the beach.
